newsitem.title: USA: Kessler to leave post as U.S. FDA chief early 1997.
newsitem.headline: Kessler to leave post as U.S. FDA chief early 1997.

text.p: Food and Drug Commissioner David Kessler, leader of the Clinton Administration's fight to regulate tobacco, will leave his post in early 1997 when a successor has been named, FDA officials said on Monday.
They said he had been asked by President Clinton to stay on as the nation's top food and drug safety official, and that he agreed, but only until a replacement was appointed.
